message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the complete combustion of propane (C3H8), assuming it reacts with oxygen (O2) to form carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O)?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the complete combustion of propane (C3H8) with oxygen (O2) to form carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O) is:

C3H8 + 5O2 â†’ 3CO2 + 4H2O
